meanings.definition: Situated or coming next below; lower.
meanings.sent1: The subdominant layer of the cake was underneath the frosting.
meanings.sent2: The basement is a subdominant level in the building.
meanings.sent3: The subdominant shelf in the store always has the best deals.
meanings.sent4: The subdominant position in the race gave her a strategic advantage.
meanings.sent5: The subdominant mountain peak was shrouded in mist, creating a mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A subdominant note or chord in music.
meanings.sent1: The subdominant in the melody added a sense of depth to the song.
meanings.sent2: The musician played the subdominant chord on the piano.
meanings.sent3: The subdominant note seemed to dance playfully with the other musical tones.
meanings.sent4: Her voice soared above the subdominant harmony like a bird in flight.
meanings.sent5: The subdominant in the symphony resonated through the concert hall, captivating the audience.
